channel.title: Webhosting
channel.description:
Hey.
I really need a new webhost, does anyone of you recommend any of them out there? I really have no clue which are good- and which aren't.
Thanks in advance!

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Trisidia:

www.reamhosting.com really cheap packages…

Just a quick note for everybody: Do not trust these guys! They has the worst customer service ever (I told them I was too young for a PayPal account and he told me they won’t find out if I faked my details and use a parents name), and I don’t think this is a legitimate hosting service. I think he tried phishing me by giving me a link to his “rsps” over live chat which was really weird.

OT: I found http://hostknight.com pretty good. It’s run by .mint and theerash (and probby more) from Rune-Server. They’re pretty dedicated

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @mrnessie mrnessie
item.description:
@mrnessie wrote:

i own this with my mate, webhosting48.com

he bought it from original owner and asked me to help him fix it

nvm he was trolling me… what a douche

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

I use http://www.reversehosts.com/ - Their VPS’s are pretty cheap and can handle alot of traffic. This company is not a reseller. The only - point here is that all their VPS’s are all Debian (Linux) so you’ll need a tutorial on hwo to setup apache on that if you have no knowledge about linux in general. Their customer support is pretty great aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Uncalled:

http://lazerhosting.com/ is something I’ve always been fond of. I like their VPS, dedicated servers, and web hosting. They generally have good customer service, and I’ve never had a problem with them.

When I was “minecraft hosting” I was like nty!

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I changed my mind about namecheap, 2 years and now they decide to ruin everything. (no incoming mysql, capped practically everything, customer service has decreased in quality)

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Trisidia, post:21, topic:522478”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=640980.msg4336783#msg4336783 date=1374504248]

www.reamhosting.com really cheap packages…

I wouldn’t trust a host that can’t make a responsive template and position a navbar.
[/quote]
Free for today and we are making a new site sir.[/quote]
Make a new one but it still doesn’t take away the fact that its a web hosting company who can’t actually make a fully functional and up-to-date site to advertise their packages on lol. Seems like a gigantic scam to me and if it isn’t it probably won’t last long.

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

TMDHosting

Fully managed lightning fast web hosting crafted for superior performance

TMDHosting offers free transfer, up to 20X faster SSD speed and 24/7/365 free premium support starting @$2.85/mo Get your FREE domain now!

I use it myself, and for all of my clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“CoderJessee, post:9, topic:522478”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=640980.msg4318844#msg4318844 date=1371935915]
I’ve used x10hosting.com for almost 6 years now, never had one single slip up with them. Their tickets are answered within an hour usually, their service never goes down, it just does exactly what it says on the tin. Their free hosting support etc isn’t very good but their Infinity package is ridiculously great, and cheap.
[/quote]
Oh thanks for the suggestion, I’ll check that out also. Do they support remote MySQL?

hosting24.com can use discount for 5.84 or so a month web hosting and comes with domain and cpannel

Thanks! I’ll check them all out :).[/quote]
yeah they do, they support just about everything you can imagine really (metaphorically speaking of course)

Read full topic

item.title: Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

I use SudoHosting, but only because I use them to host a MineCraft server so it was discounted to get the webhosting with it (since with server hosting the unmetered comes down to $2.25/month).

The support there is very good and I’ve never had a single issue with them.

http://sudohosting.net/websites

Read full topic
